title: Transfer news: Manchester United 'chase Norway and Rostov midfielder Mathias Normann'
text:
Rostov midfielder Mathias Normann is reportedly attracting the interest of struggling Manchester United.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is expected to be handed funds to strengthen his underperforming side in January.

And Normann is believed to be among their list of targets, according to Goal.

Rostov midfielder Mathias Normann is attracting the interest of struggling Manchester United

The 23-year-old is viewed as a cheap option by the manager, with Fred and Nemanja Matic struggling at the start of the season.

Tottenham and Sevilla are also among those monitoring Normann, who is valued at up to £20m by the Russian club.

Normann operates in a defensive role and was the Russian Premier League Player of the Month for September.

He played under the United manager during his spell on loan at Molde from Brighton between 2017 and 2018.
description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is expected to be handed funds to strengthen his underperforming side in January. And Normann is believed to be among their list of targets, according to Goal
